text: Leptosteges fuscipunctalis is a moth in the family Crambidae described by George Hampson in 1896. It is found in Espírito Santo, Brazil. The wingspan is about 24 mm. The forewings are pure shining white, but the costa is dusky fulvous with a dusky spot at the lower angle of the cell.Proceedings of the Zoological Society of London 1895: 910 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1896 Category:Schoenobiinae
title: Leptosteges fuscipunctalis
